doc.content: Michigan's first dove season in 100 years is only three months away, and one of the architects of the law that allowed dove hunting has drawn fire from some hunters. They say the hunt should not have been limited to six counties in southernmost Michigan. ... Gov. Jennifer Granholm signed the dove bill into law last Friday. It allows mourning dove hunting in six counties that border Indiana and Ohio, states that already have dove hunting (as does Wisconsin, which borders the western Upper Peninsula).
